title: The Spring 2025 Fashion Trends You Simply Cannot Miss
description: Get a head start on the warmer months with these.
excerpt: Get a head start on the warmer months with these.
text: With every fleeting moment of warmth from the glimpses of winter sunshine, I can’t help but get excited for the world to come alive again. Snow banks will be melting, making way for the eventual flowers to go into full bloom—and with them, the best spring 2025 fashion trends will be ready to shop.Yes, the time has come to take those notes (and fantasies) from last September’s runway shows and make them a reality. To give you a head start on the must-know trends for the season ahead, we pulled together the best ones our team has spotted for you to start shopping now. Scroll on to see them all. Higher HemlinesLAUNCHMETRICS SPOTLIGHTGucci’s spring/summer 2025 collectionIn my humble opinion, there’s nothing quite as freeing as showing a little leg the moment the temperatures warm up. Sure, you might start with a peek of the ankle, but why give an inch when you can give a (metaphorical) mile? This spring is all about the mini skirt and playing with proportions, according to the spring/summer 2025 runways, so get creative with your styling and pair your micro minis with a blouson jacket or something a little more voluminous during the transitional season.Miaou Micro Mini SkirtReformation Lydia High Rise Denim Mini SkirtStaud Supernova Skirt Jungle LeopardGucci Diagonal Coated Wool Mini SkirtWARDROBE.NYC Contour Mini Skirt in Black PlaidLingerie and Lace All-Over LAUNCHMETRICS SPOTLIGHTDolce & Gabbana’s spring/summer 2025 collection I’m starting a petition for making the lingerie trend a year-round look, but until then, you can look forward to embracing it for your hot girl spring. Between artful corsetry and lace all over, there are plenty of ways to embrace this trend. In my humble opinion, you simply can’t go wrong with a classic camisole or slip dress, and a more structured corset top is perfect for a night out, too. No, we’re not talking about the ones of the Easter egg variety. Instead, we’re looking at icy blues, soft ballet pinks, buttercream yellows, and pistachio greens. Are you ready for it? I know I am.Simone Rocha Crop Superkid Mohair & Merino Wool Blend CardiganVince Cashmere-Silk Short-Sleeve Polo SweaterALEXIS Elayne DressLeset Barb Tank DressCristopher Esber Molded Venus Mesh Maxi DressAmerican ClassicsLAUNCHMETRICS SPOTLIGHTRalph Lauren’s spring/summer 2025 collectionWe called it when we saw it last season at New York Fashion Week: Americana is back. The stars and stripes aren’t reserved for the Fourth of July, which means now could be the best time to sport the American flag if you’re feeling particularly patriotic. Of course, there were other takes on the All-American aesthetic on the runways as well in the form of workwear jackets, classic denim silhouettes, and other practical (yet stylish) staples that might have you feeling like you’re up for that State tournament.Levi's® Premium Lennox Varsity JacketAgolde Harper Mid Rise Relaxed Straight JeanRalph Lauren Flag Cotton Crewneck SweaterSporty & Rich Health Club Baseball T-shirtStudio Tomboy Corduroy-Collar Cropped JacketPicnic-Ready Plaids LAUNCHMETRICS SPOTLIGHT Warm-weather plaids and ginghams? Sign me up. If you’re looking for a quintessential print for the season, this may be one of the best to choose. Whether you opt for warmer shades of greens and reds or cooler tones of blue, this is a chic print that’ll have you basking in the sunlight in no time.Longchamp Kimono Jacket in Green Vichy JacquardSimkhai Kittiya Midi Dress in Periwinkle Sky MultiLafayette 148 New York Metallic Donegal Plaid Car CoatRosie Assoulin Hippie Skirt in RedJW Anderson Plaid Underpinning Long Sleeve Mesh TopBeyond the SeaLAUNCHMETRICS SPOTLIGHTWhether you plan to embrace the warmer weather by setting sail to the sea or you simply want to channel that energy with your sartorial choices, this season’s trends will have you covered. Nothing seems quite as classic as a Breton-striped T-shirt or even some lightweight linen pants. html:
With every fleeting moment of warmth from the glimpses of winter sunshine, I can’t help but get excited for the world to come alive again. Snow banks will be melting, making way for the eventual flowers to go into full bloom—and with them, the best spring 2025 fashion trends will be ready to shop.

Yes, the time has come to take those notes (and fantasies) from last September’s runway shows and make them a reality. To give you a head start on the must-know trends for the season ahead, we pulled together the best ones our team has spotted for you to start shopping now. Scroll on to see them all.

Higher Hemlines

Gucci’s spring/summer 2025 collection

In my humble opinion, there’s nothing quite as freeing as showing a little leg the moment the temperatures warm up. Sure, you might start with a peek of the ankle, but why give an inch when you can give a (metaphorical) mile? This spring is all about the mini skirt and playing with proportions, according to the spring/summer 2025 runways, so get creative with your styling and pair your micro minis with a blouson jacket or something a little more voluminous during the transitional season.

Miaou Micro Mini Skirt

Reformation Lydia High Rise Denim Mini Skirt

Staud Supernova Skirt Jungle Leopard

Gucci Diagonal Coated Wool Mini Skirt

WARDROBE.NYC Contour Mini Skirt in Black Plaid

Lingerie and Lace All-Over

Dolce & Gabbana’s spring/summer 2025 collection

I’m starting a petition for making the lingerie trend a year-round look, but until then, you can look forward to embracing it for your hot girl spring. Between artful corsetry and lace all over, there are plenty of ways to embrace this trend. In my humble opinion, you simply can’t go wrong with a classic camisole or slip dress, and a more structured corset top is perfect for a night out, too.

Jil Sander Lace Cami

Free People Butterfly Babe Maxi Dress

Saint Laurent Lace-trimmed Satin Slip Dress

Guizio Satin Lace Up Corset in Cream in Yellow

Scarlett Gasque The Emerald Garden Corset

The Pastel Palette

Alaïa’s spring/summer 2025 collection

Word around the ELLE office is that pastels are the colors of the season—and frankly, I’m not mad about it. No, we’re not talking about the ones of the Easter egg variety. Instead, we’re looking at icy blues, soft ballet pinks, buttercream yellows, and pistachio greens. Are you ready for it? I know I am.

Simone Rocha Crop Superkid Mohair & Merino Wool Blend Cardigan

Vince Cashmere-Silk Short-Sleeve Polo Sweater

ALEXIS Elayne Dress

Leset Barb Tank Dress

Cristopher Esber Molded Venus Mesh Maxi Dress

American Classics

Ralph Lauren’s spring/summer 2025 collection

We called it when we saw it last season at New York Fashion Week: Americana is back. The stars and stripes aren’t reserved for the Fourth of July, which means now could be the best time to sport the American flag if you’re feeling particularly patriotic. Of course, there were other takes on the All-American aesthetic on the runways as well in the form of workwear jackets, classic denim silhouettes, and other practical (yet stylish) staples that might have you feeling like you’re up for that State tournament.

Levi's® Premium Lennox Varsity Jacket

Agolde Harper Mid Rise Relaxed Straight Jean

Ralph Lauren Flag Cotton Crewneck Sweater

Sporty & Rich Health Club Baseball T-shirt

Studio Tomboy Corduroy-Collar Cropped Jacket

Picnic-Ready Plaids

Warm-weather plaids and ginghams? Sign me up. If you’re looking for a quintessential print for the season, this may be one of the best to choose. Whether you opt for warmer shades of greens and reds or cooler tones of blue, this is a chic print that’ll have you basking in the sunlight in no time.

Longchamp Kimono Jacket in Green Vichy Jacquard

Simkhai Kittiya Midi Dress in Periwinkle Sky Multi

Lafayette 148 New York Metallic Donegal Plaid Car Coat

Rosie Assoulin Hippie Skirt in Red

JW Anderson Plaid Underpinning Long Sleeve Mesh Top

Beyond the Sea

Whether you plan to embrace the warmer weather by setting sail to the sea or you simply want to channel that energy with your sartorial choices, this season’s trends will have you covered. Nothing seems quite as classic as a Breton-striped T-shirt or even some lightweight linen pants. Of course, if you want to lean in even further, there are chic knits to serve as your outer layers for those salty breezes.

J.Crew Classic Mariner Cloth Boatneck T-shirt in Stripe

Tanya Taylor Blaine Knit Dress

Cos Wide Leg Linen Drawstring Pants

Staud Cropped Hampton Sweater

Maison Common Cotton-Blend Nautical Cardigan

Why Trust ELLE

Every product featured on ELLE.com is independently researched, tested, or editor-approved. We only recommend products that we stand behind, and the merchandise featured on our site is always driven by editorial and product testing standards, not by affiliate deals or advertising relationships. Any content created in partnership with advertisers is marked as such.
